intro: Beilschmiedia vermoesenii, commonly known as the yellow-leaf beilschmiedia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that turn yellow as they mature. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Beilschmiedia vermoesenii is often found in lowland tropical rainforests, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments.
